document.docAuthor: Webb, Donald W. & Metz, Mark A.
document.masterDocTitle: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

subSubSection.paragraph: This species is named after Aubrey G. Scarbrough who collected numerous specimens of this species on the Island of San Salvador and the name is treated as a noun in apposition.

Elcaribe scarbroughi
is taxonomically associated with
E. laticornis
and
E. obscurus
in having an anterodorsal patch of dark, short setae on the gena; in lacking anteroventral and posteroventral macrosetae on the midfemur; and in having elongate, dark macrosetae along ventromedial margin of the gonocoxite in ventral view ( Fig. 244 ).
Elcaribe scarbroughi
differs from
E. laticornis
and
E. obscurus
in having the posteromedial projections of the gonocoxite in ventral view ( Fig. 244 ) almost touching medially. It differs from
E. obscurus
in having the anterior half of the ejaculatory apodeme ( Fig. 300 ) clavate and flattened dorsoventrally in cross­section with a short ventral carina

Head. Length 0.76 mm . Ommatidia smaller ventrally and laterally. Frons pruinescence brownish gray; setae dark brown. Antenna/head length 0.74; scape dark brown, pruinescence gray, dense, pedicel and flagellum dark brown, base of first flagellomere yellow; scape length 0.18 mm , width 0.10 mm , length/width 1.8, scape/ pedicel length 2.0, scape/flagellum width 0.63, setae dark brown, elongate, pale yellow setae ventrally; pedicel length 0.09 mm , length/width 0.6; first flagellomere oval, attenuate apically, flagellum length 0.29 mm , width 0.16 mm , length/width 1.8, flagellum/scape length 1.6. Parafacial pruinescence gray. Maxillary palpus dark yellow, base dark reddish brown; length 0.36 mm , length/width 6.0; setae white. Genal setae white. Occipital setae white becoming appressed, lanceolate dorsally.

Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Mesonotum pruinescence gray, dense; setae black, elongate intermixed with white, lanceolate, appressed setae. Pleuron pruinescence gray; setae white on anepisternum, katepisternum, metanepisternum, laterotergite, and scutellum. Wing. Membrane pale gray; veins pale yellowish brown; length 5.0 mm, length/width 2.9; pterostigma indistinct; cell m 3 closed, petiolate. Halter yellow. Legs. Femora dark reddish brown, pruinescence white; ventral setae black intermixed with white setae ventrally on forefemur, white on midfemur; av 3:0:4, pv 0:0:1. Tibiae dark yellow, apex dark reddish brown. Tarsomeres 1–2 dark yellow, apex dark reddish brown; 3–5 dark reddish brown.
Variation (n=10). Body length 5.8–7.1, 6.6 mm . Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 1–3:0:3–5, pv 0:0:0–1.
Similar to male except as follows.
Head. Frons pruinescence light brownish gray; setae dark brown. Antenna dark brown.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 1–2:0:2–4, pv 0:0:1.

Abdomen. Dark reddish brown, posterior margin of tergites 2–5 dark yellow becoming broader posteriorly; dorsal setae dark reddish brown with white, elongate, appressed setae across posterior margin of tergite 1; lateral setae white, elongate on tergite 1, dark reddish brown on tergites 2–8.
Terminalia
(MEI 141729). Anterior margin of sternite 8 with rounded lobate medial projection ( Fig. 341 ). Furca (Fig. 353) oval; length 0.66 mm , width 0.23 mm ; posteromedial and anteromedial projections absent, anterolateral projection short. Common duct (Fig. 353) shorter than furca. Spermathecal duct (Fig. 353) narrow sac­like then becoming thread­like.

Distribution Elcaribe scarbroughi
has been collected in The Bahamas ( Fig. 357 ).

Adults of
Elcaribe scarbroughi
have been handnetted and collected in Malaise traps, yellow pan traps in Caribbean pine and palmetto scrub, and blacklight traps.

Type specimen. The holotype male of
Elcaribe scarbroughi Webb
(MEI 141723) is labeled " THE BAHAMAS , San Salvador Island , Rd. S. CCFL, 31–VI 1980 , A. G. Scarbrough" and is deposited in the INHS.
